supporting_text: The need to control and combat antimicrobial resistance should be implemented within the framework of one health approach through multi-sectorial cooperation and coordination between Human, animal and environmental sectors.
Goal focuses on improving awareness and understanding of AMR through effective communication; education and training, thus bringing about a change in behaviour of user and prescribers.

Goal 2 aims to promote rational and optimized use of antibiotics in various settings through strengthening of enforcement of regulations; ensuring access and surveillance of antimicrobial use, antimicrobial stewardship in healthcare as well as animal health and agriculture.
The NAP emphasizes the importance of environmental health in the context of One Health approach.
Goal 2 includes optimizing the use of antimicrobial medicines in human and animal health, which encompasses agriculture.
A monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) Plan has also been proposed to keep track of the progress made and modifying the operational plan, if needed.
By 2022, Egypt will achieve ten percent reduction in deaths associated with drug resistant pathogens.
The NAP includes specific targets such as a ten percent reduction in total use of antibiotics in the country.
The operational plan identifies various activities that need to be carried out by different sectors in a time bound manner to meet the targets set in this NAP.
The operational plan includes estimated budgets for various activities.
The Egyptian Government designated its National Focal Point (NFP) in Ministry of Health to lead and coordinate national efforts on development of its National Action Plan on AMR.
The NAP includes activities aimed at reviewing current legislation for regulating antimicrobial prescribing and dispensing practices.
The NAP mentions the inclusion of the use of antimicrobial agents and resistance in school curricula.
Public awareness on rational use of antimicrobial agents and necessity for bringing about change in their behaviour towards rational use of these medicines has been recognized in the NAP.
The NAP is aligned with the global action plan and recognizes the importance of international collaboration.
The NAP aims to strengthen National One-Health Surveillance Efforts to combat resistance that can arise in humans, animals, and the environment.
The NAP includes strengthening the knowledge and evidence base through research, which encompasses detection and reporting of resistance.
The NAP emphasizes the importance of infection prevention and control practices in healthcare settings.
The NAP aligns with the global action plan which advocates for international standards and guidelines.
The NAP includes activities aimed at regulating antimicrobial prescribing and dispensing practices.
The NAP includes the need for enforcement of regulations to promote rational use of antibiotics.
The NAP encourages partnerships with international research institutes to support the development of new treatments.
